The space is super cozy and low key, so when you want to truly catch-up with friends without the bar scene, this place is for you AND street parking is free and relatively easy!
author: Lori G.

description: Ok- I might be a little biased, while waiting for our condo to close we created our own superstition - if we became regulars at Yield then we would actually get through closing and thus be "regulars".  It worked, we drank ourselves silly for 60 days and now can claim the title of "regulars who live in the hood". Nice- now about the wine-  it is superb.  They have a very subtle selection of organic wines, the selection changes often so you never find yourself in a rut of ordering the same ole shit!  Here is the best advice I can give- saddle up to the bar and ask, Chris, Duncan or Nick to surprise you- and not with a glass, anyone can do that, bring a friend and spilt the bottle; don't worry the T line on the Muni goes by the front of Yield you really have no excuse.  After you have opened that special bottle of wine- ask which one of Kevin divine small plate dishes you should have- they all rock.  Then call it a night and go home and feel really jealous of me because I get to do this several nights a week- I'm a regular remember and I live in the friggin neighborhood :)
author: Brian C.

description: i really enjoyed Yield.  i had a great glass of wine (i had a Syrah, i think there were two kinds, i don't remember which one i had).  the atmosphere is really great and comfy.  the servers there were both very kind and attentive.  it wasn't too busy when we got there, but it picked up a bit and died down again.  the flatbeads are really good.  overall, i had a wonderful experience there.
author: Anthony R.

description: I love this place.  Excellent rotating selection of wines from all over the world.  The menu changes often and offers great bites.   The staff/ownership is incredibly friendly and knowledgeable about the wine and food.  Great place to relax with a group of friends and try some new wines.
author: Larry W.

description: my coworker discovered this gem as a happy hour jaunt prior to president's day weekend.  (i know this is grossly overdue.)  with wine's described as approachable and a staff eager to recommend vintages, it's a great place to chill out.   we had the olives and cheese plate, which were quite enjoyable.  we were the first one's in there and by the time we left the place it was packed even on a dreary rainy day.
author: Sharlene C.

description: exactly my kind of place.  dive bar, no pretension, good people. love it
author: James R.

description: A great little spot to meet up with friends for some wine and chat. It's very low-key, not at all snobby, and serves tasty snacks and tastier wines.
author: Hilary R.

description: Dare I give this place too glowing of a recommendation in case it becomes so popular that a big inviting leather chair isn't waiting for me the next time I visit..... i love this place from start to finish. The parking is easy, the atmosphere is casual yet cool, the wine is great (and organic so it is good for you!) and the owner is so sweet that you just want so badly for him to succeed. Best wine bar in the city (and yes... I've been to Hidden Vine)
author: Michelle D.

description: This place rocks.  i eat gluten free.  i also like to snack while tasting/drinking/whateveryouwanttocallit.  So i order the cheese plate to go with my flight of, might i add, amazing wines.  And they're out of apples, my substitute for bread with cheese.   Unbeknownst to us, the server (who turns out to be THE OWNER) runs to the corner store.  He then brings us a plate of amazing cheese, with sliced apple.  It was amazing.  And, they comp'd us a glass of champagne at the end of the night when we were curious how it tasted.  Very chill, tasty wine, i'll definitely be back.
author: andrea w.

description: I went last weekend.  It was cool, had a great wine list, and a very friendly atmosphere.  The place looks like it could be ground zero for the neighborhood flip that will likely happen in lower potrero/dogpatch over the next year.  The owner (Chris) is very friendly.  Highly recommended.
author: Kelly D.
